Class SchemaController

java.lang.Object
edu.rit.g2.controller.SchemaController
public class SchemaController extends Object
Controller class responsible for coordinating interactions between the SchemaModel (data layer) and SchemaView (presentation layer) within the Schema2Script application.

This class implements the Controller role of the MVC architectural pattern. It:

  • Loads and parses schema definition files (JSON or XML).
  • Updates the SchemaModel with parsed data.
  • Handles SQL generation requests using the selected DBMS generator.
  • Notifies the view about success or error outcomes.

All functional operations performed by the view — such as loading a file, parsing it, selecting DBMS types, and generating SQL — are delegated to this controller to maintain proper separation of concerns.

Since:
1.0

  • Constructor Details

    • SchemaController

      public SchemaController(SchemaModel model, SchemaView view)
      Creates a new SchemaController instance.
      Parameters:
      model - the schema model representing the application's data state; must not be null
      view - the view used to display messages and results to the user; must not be null
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if either parameter is null

  • Method Details

    • handleSchemaUpload

      public void handleSchemaUpload(File schemaFile)
      Loads and parses a schema file by automatically detecting its format based on the filename extension.

      If the format cannot be determined (i.e., not JSON or XML), the view is notified of the error and parsing is aborted.

      Parameters:
      schemaFile - the file selected by the user; may be null

    • handleSchemaUpload

      public void handleSchemaUpload(File schemaFile, String format)
      Loads and parses a schema file using the explicitly provided format.

      The method validates the input, retrieves the appropriate parser via ParserFactory, attempts to parse the file, and updates the model if successful.

      Any parsing- or format-related errors are communicated back through the SchemaView.

      Parameters:
      schemaFile - the schema file to parse; must not be null
      format - the file format (e.g., "json", "xml"); must not be empty

    • handleGenerateSql

      public void handleGenerateSql(File schemaFile, String inputFormat, DbmsType dbms)
      Generates SQL code based on the currently selected schema file, input format, and target DBMS type.

      The method:

      1. Parses the schema again (ensuring consistency).
      2. Uses SqlGeneratorFactory to obtain a generator.
      3. Creates SQL using SqlGenerator.generateLogged(SchemaModel).
      4. Saves the generated SQL to target/generated/schema.sql.
      5. Notifies the view of success or failure.
      Parameters:
      schemaFile - the source schema file to parse
      inputFormat - the format provided (json or xml)
      dbms - the database target type (MySQL, Postgres, Oracle)
